Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(billing\): implement webhook improvements with tracing and idempotency

Backend improvements:
- Add trace_id to WebhookLog for request correlation across logs
- Add provider_event_id field to store YooKassa native event IDs
- Implement proper idempotency using provider_event_id \(primary\) or computed key \(fallback\)
- Add payload sanitization to redact sensitive card data before DB storage
- Improve logging with structured trace_id in all webhook processing stages
- Add detailed IP tracking \(remote_addr vs XFF\) for security auditing
- Implement exponential backoff retry strategy for webhook tasks
- Add database migration for new fields with indexes

Frontend improvements:
- Add usePaymentPolling hook for real-time payment status tracking
- Improve subscription actions with better error handling
- Export new hooks from billing feature module

Testing:
- Add comprehensive webhook improvements test suite

Observability:
- All webhook logs now include trace_id for end-to-end request tracking
- Enhanced structured logging format: [WEBHOOK_*] trace_id=xxx log_id=yyy task_id=zzz
- Better debugging capabilities for webhook delivery issues

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(ai\): implement P0/P1 security and lifecycle fixes for async AI flow

This commit addresses critical security and data integrity issues in the AI food recognition system:

**P0 Security Fixes:**
- Add task ownership validation via cache to prevent unauthorized access to AI results
- Implement strict meal ownership checks in task processing
- Add hardened image validation using magic bytes detection
- Add owner_id field to all task responses for audit trail

**P1 Data Integrity Fixes:**
- Defer meal creation until AI successfully returns items \(no more orphan meals\)
- Delete meal atomically if AI fails, returns empty results, or controlled errors
- Fix batch upload lifecycle: proper cancellation and cleanup on unmount
- Add comprehensive test coverage for ownership isolation and edge cases

**Backend Changes:**
- tasks.py: Meal now created only on success, ownership checks, delete on failure
- views.py: Return 202 with meal_id=null, link task to user in cache
- New tests: test_extra_async.py, test_extra_tasks.py for edge cases

**Frontend Changes:**
- Batch results modal: show items count, proper error states
- Task polling: handle null meal_id, improved cancellation
- API types: add owner_id, make meal_id nullable during processing

All tests passing. Ready for production deployment.

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(nutrition\): implement multi-photo meal architecture

Refactor from Meal \(1\) ‚Üí Photo \(1\) to Meal \(1\) ‚Üí MealPhoto \(N\):

Backend:
- Add MealPhoto model with per-photo status tracking \(PENDING/PROCESSING/SUCCESS/FAILED\)
- Add Meal.status field for lifecycle \(DRAFT/PROCESSING/COMPLETE\)
- Implement draft meal grouping within 10-minute window
- Update AI task to create MealPhoto records with isolated failure handling
- Add meal_id parameter to recognition API for photo grouping
- Create data migration to preserve existing photos

Frontend:
- Track meal_id across batch photo uploads
- Add MealPhotoGallery component with swipeable navigation
- Update MealsList with photo strip display
- Add photo gallery to MealDetailsPage with arrows and dot indicators

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
